content: I propose to implement multi-grib support (initial proposal at https://github.com/OpenCPN/OpenCPN/issues/4228). Should I plan to discuss and make changes in the existing grib plugin? Or create a new multi-grib plugin? Enhancing the existing plugin seems the right thing to do, but perhaps there are reasons not. Or perhaps I should do both. Thank you. Sebastien
I would extend the current plugin, the mutli-grib use case should probably not be diametrally different.

As you probably know, Sebastien grib_pi does support showing two gribs so that RTOFS can be used for current. The manual has a section which shows how to do this.
List of Plugins https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:set_options:plugin_manager

Load two grib files concurrently

@Rick Gleason , yes I am aware. I'm thinking about being able to load both a 48-hour HRRR model and GFS/ECMWF model, then do an isochron computation that takes HRRR for more precise routing. Or quickly comparing different models to check if they show dissimilarities. AFAIK, loading 2 models that have the same parameter type (e.g. wind or wind gust) isn't well supported.
